text.config.firewall-config.title: Firewall configuration
text.config.firewall-config.category.cus:
Clients communicating with servers sometimes use custom payload packets, aka plugin channels.
Here are some identifiers of packets that may be worth suppressing:

minecraft:brand: The brand packet, used by Vanilla and modded Minecraft clients.
minecraft:register: Tells the receiver the custom channels that the sender can accept.
minecraft:unregister: Tells the receiver the custom channels that the sender doesn't accept.
visiblebarriers:mod_installed: The Visible Barriers mod sends this packet on a server join.
text.config.firewall-config.category.reg:
Allowed channel identifiers in minecraft:register and minecraft:unregister packets,
sent by Bukkit, BungeeCord, Velocity and Fabric API.
text.config.firewall-config.option.regis:
Should the mod send or reject empty channel lists.
Fabric API internally sends the channel list iff it isn't empty.

Should the mod receive or reject empty channel lists.
Fabric API internally sends the channel list iff it isn't empty.
text.config.firewall-config.option.brand: The brand packet tells the server what client you're using, like 'vanilla', 'fabric', etc.
'vanilla', 'fabric' or anything else. Used only if the brand overwrite is enabled.
text.config.firewall-config.category.log: What packets should be logged - regardless of if they're rejected or not.
What custom payloads should be logged - regardless of if they're rejected or not.
